column1: Wild bird trends in the United Kingdom, 1970 to 2022
This spreadsheet contains the data tables published alongside the statistics for Wild bird populations in the United Kingdom: 1970 to 2022.
Wild bird populations in the UK
The data tables in this workbook were first published at 9:30am on 7 November 2023.
All the indicators in this workbook including those for upland birds are published as National Statistics.
All content is available under the Open Government Licence v3.0, except where otherwise stated

The long-term trend applies to data from the first year of the available time series for the specific index or individual species to the penultimate year of the time series; the short-term trend applies to 5 years of data to the penultimate year of the time series (6 data points in total).

Data are presented as an index; the first year of the available time series for each specific index is set to 100.

Some cells in the tables refer to notes which can be found in the notes worksheet. Note markers are presented in square brackets, for example: [note 1].

Some column headings give date ranges, when this is the case the data ranges are presented in round brackets to differentiate them from note markers.
